title: Carbon Copy Cloner 3.5.6 [k'd] {100.XY}

Supported OS: OS X 10.6 +

Language: English 

System requirements:

Description:
Carbon Copy Cloner - a good tool for data backup.
Carbon Copy Cloner - allows you to completely clone the hard disk and store it separately on another computer or external media. In the future, you can quickly restore your system, install all applications, drivers, documents, etc. Also, the utility will help with regular data backup. To do this, simply select the source disk, install / remove the check mark next to the required items and select the directory will be copied. All these operations can be carried out even from another computer on the network. Now, in the case of data damage, equipment failures, or any other disaster recover all the information will be very simple.
Additional Information:
Carbon Copy Cloner allows you to create full or partial clone of your system, transferring it to another drive, or save it as a. Dmg (disk image). In recent versions of Carbon Copy Cloner, oriented system Snow Leopard (or later), supported by the compression in the file system HFS +, noticeably more comfortable and became the show folder sizes and drive in decimal, the increased rate up, and ignored database Time Machine, if they already been created. 
Bombiccite Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Mike (Mike Bombich), the creator of this wonderful program, in an interview with the popular American website highlighted the "highlights" of his creation: the speed of the cloning process, the ability to selectively transfer data and additional protection against accidental operation by a special list of all possible candidates disk request their ID (unique identifier). 
Carbon Copy Cloner can be very useful when you upgrade the system drive and replacing it with a more capacious. Enough to move ahead otklonirovannuyu system to a new disk.
Note for users updating from CCC 3.5.6:
CCC 3.5.5 resolved a minor bug related to the handling of corrupted Access Control List entries. This update makes a minor improvement to the implementation of that bug fix. 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed an issue in which the lack of support for large extended attributes on a Drobo volume would result in the backup task being aborted prematurely.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Errors caused by the Synology NAS file sharing server's inability to serve up Synology-proprietary extended attributes are now more effectively filtered out.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ CCC now prohibits copying a source volume that has ownership disabled directly to the startup disk. Users can select a subfolder on each volume instead. 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixed a condition that could lead to CCC reporting that two volumes with the same UUID were detected. 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Withdrew a configuration change that did not improve CCC's detection of dropped connections to a remote Macintosh.

Installation Procedure:
Mount image and drag Carbon Copy Cloner.app in a folder with the programs.
